The NCLAT has ordered the National Company Law Tribunal to reconsider the case. This decision follows the NCLAT's review of new project status reports and Supreme Court rulings. Homebuyers and financial creditors have also been granted opportunities to present their cases before the NCLT.

items.title: Top Gainers & Losers on Nov 07: Amber Enterprises, Bharti Airtel, Suzlon Energy, OLA, Delhivery among top losers
items.summary: Indian key averages ended Friday's session flat after recovering from intraday lows, with Nifty 50 down 0.05% and Sensex down 0.12%. The Nifty PSU Bank index led gains, while the Nifty Consumer Durables and IT indices were the main laggards.

items.title: India's big bank moment has arrived. Why it matters
items.summary: India aims to build global-scale banks. This consolidation of PSBs will create mega institutions. These banks will finance the nation's growing infrastructure, manufacturing, and technology needs. The move supports India's vision of becoming a developed economy by 2047. Stronger, larger banks are essential for sustained rapid growth and global competitiveness.

items.title: BSE, other capital market stocks zoom up to 11% on supportive F&O commentary by FM, SEBI chairman
items.summary: BSE shares rose sharply along with other capital market-linked stocks like CDSL and Angel One after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and Sebi chief Tuhin Kanta Pandey offered supportive comments on the Futures & Options (F&O) segment, assuring calibrated reforms and continued regulatory consultation.

items.title: Aegis Vopak Terminals approves issuance of NCDs worth ₹600 cr
items.summary: The NCDs will have a three-year tenure with a 6.9% interest rate. They are proposed to be listed on the NSE

items.title: WEF says AI, robotics, nanotech to transform agriculture; cites case studies from India
items.summary: The report, titled 'Shaping the Deep-Tech Revolution in Agriculture' and developed in collaboration with stakeholders from both industry and academia, comes at a time when agriculture globally faces a convergence of crises

items.title: Radico Khaitan launches coffee-infused premium dark rum in Uttar Pradesh
items.summary: Radico Khaitan’s move taps into urban consumers’ growing preference for artisanal, flavour-forward spirits.

items.title: Lenskart IPO listing date in focus. Here’s what GMP signals ahead of share debut on Dalal Street
items.summary: Lenskart IPO listing date is November 10, and the shares will be listed on BSE and NSE. Ahead of the share debut, Lenskart IPO GMP today signals a decent listing of shares.

items.title: Why FIIs are buying these three companies even as domestic investors exit
items.summary: Foreign investors are quietly raising stakes in three companies even as domestic institutional investors and retail investors book profits — a rare divergence that may signal early conviction, though not yet a lasting trend.

items.title: 5 electrode and refractory stocks to watch as the green steel cycle heats up
items.summary: As steelmakers shift toward electric arc furnaces, five Indian electrode and refractory stocks—Graphite India, HEG, RHI Magnesita, Raghav, and IFGL—are set to benefit from the green steel wave.

items.title: Economic growth to be north of 6.8% in FY26: CEA
items.summary: “My original range was 6.3 to 6.8% (projected in Economic Survey). Now I think there is a lot of comfort in saying it would be definitely north of 6.8 but... I will wait for the second quarter numbers to come before I move even a notch higher,” CEA Nageswaran said

items.title: SEBI will form working groups to review short-selling, SLBM frameworks soon, says Pandey
items.summary: SEBI will also be introducing the closing auction framework soon, “aligned with other global jurisdictions but suitably designed for our requirements”

items.title: UP Tourism invites entrepreneurs to set up Wellness Centres across the state
items.summary: Uttar Pradesh is inviting entrepreneurs to build wellness centres and resorts. This initiative under the Tourism Policy 2022 aims to promote holistic health and traditional healing. The state seeks to become a national hub for health and rejuvenation tourism. Benefits like capital investment support and exemptions are offered.

items.title: Weekly options ban to have limited impact on NSE financials, says CEO Chauhan
items.summary: With expiry-day trades forming less than a third of total turnover, NSE expects limited impact from Sebi’s proposed rule change.

items.title: Hindalco Q2 profit rises 21% to ₹4,741 crore on strong performance by India business
items.summary: The company had posted a consolidated profit after tax of ₹3,909 crore in the  year-ago period, Hindalco Industries Ltd said in a filing to BSE

items.title: Plugging into global value chains key to next phase of PLI success: CEA Nageswaran
items.summary: CEA V. Anantha Nageswaran says India must move from indigenisation to strategic resilience by plugging deeper into global value chains, even as mobile exports surge under the PLI scheme.

items.title: Why is the Indian stock market struggling to hit new highs despite strong growth, low inflation? Explained
items.summary: Despite favourable growth and low inflation, the Indian stock market struggles to achieve new highs. Analysts believe that government reforms and positive macro indicators could reverse this trend if trade deal uncertainties are resolved.

items.title: PFC Q2 Results: Maharatna PSU's net profit rises 2% YoY to  ₹4,462 crore; second interim dividend declared
items.summary: PFC Q2 Results: Maharatna PSU Power Finance Corporation declared a 2% YoY rise in its standalone net profits for the July-September quarter to  ₹4,462 crore. The company also announced a second interim dividend with its record date.

items.title: China's exports fall 1.1% in October, hit by 25% drop in shipments to U.S.
items.summary: China's shipments to the U.S. have already fallen by double-digits for seven consecutive months, while it has diversified its export markets to regions such as Southeast Asia and Africa

items.title: Shedding market myopia: Excessive QoQ focus can make you miss some multibaggers, says Gurmeet Chadha
items.summary: Market experts caution against overemphasizing quarter-on-quarter earnings, urging investors to look at long-term growth drivers in sectors like manufacturing and pharma, where firms are investing heavily in R&D, capacity expansion, and strategic acquisitions that may temporarily impact short-term profitability but build lasting value.

items.title: Tenneco Clean Air India IPO opens next week: GMP among 10 things you should know before investing
items.summary: Tenneco Clean Air India, backed by US-based Tenneco Inc, will open its ₹3,600 crore IPO on November 12, entirely an offer for sale. With a 24% grey market premium, strong financials, and leadership in emission control systems, the issue has drawn solid investor interest ahead of listing.

items.title: In search of returns, more Indians invest aboard—not just in the US, Europe, but as far as Brazil, China
items.summary: Indians are increasingly investing overseas faced with underwhelming returns at home. DIY platforms like Vested Finance and Borderless are facilitating this trend, with significant growth in trading volumes for US, Chinese, and Brazilian stocks.

items.title: Alembic Pharmaceuticals gets USFDA nod for generic blood cancer treatment drug
items.summary: The approval by the USFDA is for the abbreviated new drug application (ANDA) of Dasatinib Tablets of strengths 20 mg, 50 mg, 70 mg, 80 mg, 100 mg, and 140 mg, Alembic Pharmaceuticals said in a regulatory filing

items.title: Reliance Retail's Tira enters makeup category with launch of lip plumping tint
items.summary: Reliance Retail's Tira beauty platform enters the makeup segment with its first colour product, the Tira Lip Plumping Peptint. Available in nine shades, the vegan and cruelty-free Peptint aims to make beauty simpler and more experiential for Indian consumers.

items.title: Speak local, tweak HR policies for better appraisals to local staff: FM Sitharaman to PSBs
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urged public sector banks to prioritize regional language proficiency for employees, advocating for its inclusion in performance appraisals. She stressed the importance of personal connect with customers, advising banks to reduce excessive documentation and leverage local language skills for better customer service and business growth.

items.title: Alembic Pharmaceuticals gets USFDA nod for generic blood cancer treatment drug
items.summary: Alembic Pharmaceuticals has secured final approval from the USFDA for its generic Dasatinib tablets. These tablets are used to treat certain blood cancers in adults and children. The approval covers multiple strengths of the drug. Dasatinib is a vital medication for patients with Philadelphia chromosome-positive chronic myeloid leukemia and acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

items.title: Hindalco Q2 results: Consolidated PAT rises 21% YoY to  ₹4,741 crore
items.summary: Hindalco Q2 results: Aditya Birla Group company Hindalco Industries on November 7 posted a 21 per cent year-on-year rise in its consolidated PAT for Q2FY26 at  ₹4,741 crore. Revenue from operations rose 13.5 per cent YoY.

items.title: LIC hopes it can off-set GST hit by managing expenses, selling more policies
items.summary: While some private insurers are reconsidering commission payouts to offset the loss of input tax credit, LIC said it will pass the full benefit to customers through premiums and will not shift any GST burden onto intermediaries.

items.title: Studds Accessories share price trades flat after weak listing. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.summary: Studds Accessories shares were listed at  ₹565.00 apiece on the NSE, a discount of  ₹20, or 3.42%, to the issue price of  ₹585.00 per share. On BSE, Studds Accessories shares were listed with a discount of 2.56% at  ₹570 apiece.

items.title: David beats Goliath again: How mid-tier IT firms are outpacing India’s tech giants
items.summary: For the second straight year, mid-tier IT firms like LTIMindtree, Coforge, and Persistent are on track to grow faster and earn higher margins than TCS and Infosys.

items.title: How NSE’s electricity futures are reshaping India’s power market
items.summary: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) is emerging as a frontrunner in India’s power derivatives market, with electricity futures gaining strong traction among traders, industrial users, and generators. Head of Issuer Relationship Harish Ahuja said NSE holds nearly 80% market share, with prices aligning to India’s “One Nation, One Grid, One Price” policy and growing industrial participation driving volumes.

items.title: NSE's long-term trajectory intact, F&O tightening key risk: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: Motilal Oswal expects NSE’s long-term growth to remain strong despite near-term pressure from a one-time SEBI settlement fee, forecasting steady revenue and profit growth driven by diversified income streams, product innovation, and sustained market dominance.

items.title: India's rapid renewables rollout vs demand mismatch driving up power costs, official says
items.summary: India's fast renewable energy expansion is straining its power grid and increasing electricity costs. Demand growth has not matched the rapid rise in renewable power output. This situation poses challenges for managing surplus energy and ensuring grid stability.

items.title: Steel Ministry gives green light to Arcelor Mittal steel plant’s slurry pipeline
items.summary: The Steel Ministry has approved laying a pipeline to carry slurry to the proposed steel plant

items.title: Chhattisgarh's fossil fuel subsidies 4x more than clean energy support: Report
items.summary: Chhattisgarh's energy sector received over INR 16,672 crore in government support in FY2024, but fossil fuels garnered four times more than renewables.  With 80% of energy revenues from fossil fuels, the state faces significant exposure to future energy shifts.  Experts urge proactive fiscal planning and diversification to secure long-term growth and align with national clean energy goals.

items.title: Europe's STOXX 600 steady after volatile week; ITV soars
items.summary: European shares edged up on Friday, in what appeared to be a steady end to a week marred by worries about elevated valuations of technology-related stocks globally, while the UK's ITV jumped on a potential sale of its broadcasting division

items.title: Honda cuts annual operating profit outlook on EV cost hit, slow Asia sales
items.summary: Honda Motor has significantly lowered its full-year profit forecast by 21% due to substantial one-time electric vehicle expenses, declining sales in China and other Asian markets, and a critical shortage of Nexperia chips. The Japanese automaker also reduced its 2030 EV sales target and anticipates selling fewer vehicles in Asia this fiscal year amidst intense competition from Chinese manufacturers.

items.title: Brokerages reaffirm bullish outlook on Paytm; cite profitability momentum, AI-led growth
items.summary: Major brokerages, including Bernstein, Jefferies, JM Financial, Mirae Asset Capital Markets, Emkay Global, and YES Securities, have reiterated their positive stance on One 97 Communications Ltd (Paytm) following its Q2FY26 results.

items.title: Wakefit Innovations to launch sub-brands to widen market reach
items.summary: Wakefit Innovations plans to raise fresh capital of ₹468 crore through IPO

items.title: Exponent Energy enters retrofit business, launches ‘Exponent Oto’ 15-Minute rapid-charging retrofit EV technology
items.summary: Exponent Energy has launched 'Exponent Oto,' a technology to retrofit existing CNG and LPG three-wheelers into EVs with 15-minute rapid-charging batteries. This initiative offers drivers immediate monthly savings and a swift transition to clean mobility, with retrofits completed in just 24 hours and backed by a 5-year warranty.

items.title: Textile major Arvind Ltd posts 70% rise in profits for Q2 FY26
items.summary: Net profit rose to ₹107 crore; revenue up 8.4% to ₹2,371 crore, aided by 10% growth in revenues from textiles and 15% rise in revenues from Advanced Materials

items.title: 10 high-growth, high-margin stocks surged up to 97% in a year; Are you in or out?
items.summary: A focused group of 41 companies from the BSE 500 delivered over 10% sales and profit growth in Q2, maintaining profit margins above 10%. Excluding banking and financials, more than half rewarded shareholders with positive returns, with the top ten stocks surging between 20% and 97%.

items.title: Venky's Q2 Results: Firm posts net loss of  ₹27 crore vs profit a year ago amid challenges in poultry segment
items.summary: This financial setback is attributed to various market challenges, particularly in the poultry segment, which faced lower realizations from the sale of day-old chicks and grown-up birds.

items.title: Climate change-linked stocks are dominating the market—Ground realities continue to beat Trump’s denial
items.summary: With the Trump administration scrapping environmental regulations and cleantech subsidies in favour of fossil fuels, clean energy stocks should have tanked. Instead, they have dominated the bourse thanks to demand from energy-hungry AI. The market has its ears to the ground, despite loud rhetoric.

items.title: Kirloskar Ferrous Industries’ Q2 consolidated PAT up 11% to ₹86.3 crore
items.summary: EBITDA margin improves to 12.4%; Consolidated revenue from operations grew 5% year-on-year to ₹1,755.3 crore

items.title: Hindalco Q2 Results: Cons profit jumps 21% YoY to Rs 4,741 crore, revenue up 13%
items.summary: Hindalco Q2 Results: Hindalco Industries announced a robust 21% year-on-year increase in its consolidated net profit for Q2, reaching Rs 4,741 crore. This growth was accompanied by a 13% rise in revenue from operations, which stood at Rs 66,058 crore for the quarter. The company's financial performance reflects strong year-on-year gains.

items.title: Madhu Kela-backed FMCG stock sets board meeting date to declare Q2 results 2025, bonus shares
items.summary: GRM Overseas Ltd's board will meet on November 13, 2025, to review Q2 results and consider bonus equity shares. The company reported Q1 FY26 net sales of  ₹334.4 crore and a net profit of  ₹19.1 crore, with a fiscal year net sales increase of 2.2%.

items.title: Go Fashion Q2 Results: Profit rises 6% YoY to  ₹22 crore; margins decline
items.summary: In a statement, Gautam Saraogi, CEO of Go Fashion, highlighted the positive consumer sentiment during the festive season, which contributed to the company's growth.

items.title: Indian firms need to work harder to protect secrets
items.summary: The Supreme Court's ruling that in-house counsels on a company’s payroll cannot claim client-attorney privilege is expected to inflate Indian companies' legal bills.&nbsp;

items.title: Deepak Fertilisers Q2 results: Revenue up 9%; PAT steady at ₹214 crore
items.summary: The company invested ₹870 crore in capital expenditure during the first half

items.title: BSE share price jumps 7% despite muted trend on Dalal Street. Should you buy?
items.summary: BSE share price has surged 16% over the past month and 18% in the last six months. On a year-to-date (YTD) basis, the stock has gained 44%, while it has advanced 60% over the past one year.

items.title: Groww IPO vs Pine Labs IPO: Here's what GMP, experts hint about listing gains
items.summary: IPO review: As the Groww IPO concludes its bidding, it shows a subscription rate of 3.81 times. Experts recommend cautious investment due to past IPO performances. Pine Labs offers stable returns in enterprise payments, while Groww represents a high-risk, high-reward retail investment opportunity.

items.title: Saatvik Green Energy subsidiary secures orders worth ₹299.40 crore
items.summary: The orders have been placed by three reputed Independent Power Producers and EPC players in India, further strengthening Saatvik’s visibility in the fast-growing domestic solar market

items.title: Jefferies sees Reliance Jio poised for strong growth; forecasts 18% revenue CAGR, $180 billion valuation by FY28
items.summary: Reliance Jio is well-positioned to deliver strong growth over the next few years, supported by rising telecom tariffs and rapid expansion in its home broadband segment, particularly through Fixed Wireless Access (FWA), according to a report by Jefferies.

items.title: FDI compliance must for foreign loans in realty, RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra clarifies
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's Governor Sanjay Malhotra has clarified that relaxed external commercial borrowing limits apply only to FDI-compliant real estate projects, not speculative ventures. He also indicated that banks may soon be allowed to finance acquisitions, a move expected to benefit the real economy.

items.title: Trump says trade talks with India are ‘going good’ but keeps up pressure on Russian oil
items.summary: US Commerce Secretary Lutnick asserts that tariffs are to stop Russia-Ukraine war; India maintains oil purchase is sovereign decision

items.title: Jefferies’ Chris Wood sees value emerging if gold prices fall another 15%. Here's why
items.summary: Gold price is currently trading around $4,012/oz, and Chris Wood believes a correction of about 16% could create an attractive buying opportunity, aligning with the 200-day moving average of $3,371/oz.

items.title: IT rationalisation sparks a strategic reset for India’s staffing industry
items.summary: While India’s job market is projected to grow by 9% in 2025, typical high-volume hiring has notably slowed, particularly in transactional and generic roles

items.summary: GST implementation led to an estimated 2–2.5% impact on the top line, said Varun Berry, Executive Vice-Chairman, Managing Director & Chief Executive Officer

items.title: AI plane crash: Pilot not to be blamed, don’t carry burden on yourself, says SC to pilot’s father
items.summary: “You should not carry burden on yourself. The pilot is not to be blamed for the plane crash. It was an accident. There is no insinuation against him even in the preliminary report,” the bench said

items.title: After Mamdani’s win, Democrats face a defining choice: double down on the left or return to the center
items.summary: Zohran Mamdani’s NYC mayoral victory has ignited fierce debate in the Democratic Party—whether bold populist ideas or centrist pragmatism offers the surer path to national power. Beyond the political optics, Democrats must come to a consensus on critical issues. Style matters, but so does substance.

items.title: What is overshadowing Godrej Properties robust H1 pre-sales?
items.summary: Godrej Properties' stock performance has been unimpressive, dropping 22% so far in 2025 versus 11% decline in the Nifty Realty index.

items.title: SEBI to comprehensively review short selling and SLBM frameworks: Tuhin Kanta Pandey
items.summary: SEBI chief Tuhin Kanta Pandey announced a comprehensive review of short selling and the securities lending and borrowing mechanism, highlighting the need for development. He emphasised strong investor participation and ongoing reforms to streamline capital-raising processes.

items.title: When should you exit mutual funds? Vishwajeet Parashar shares the golden rules for smart profit booking
items.summary: Mutual fund expert Vishwajeet Parashar explains the golden rules for exiting mutual funds smartly. Investors should start booking profits six months to a year before their goal, follow strategic asset allocation, and avoid emotional exits during market swings. He advises annual rebalancing, partial withdrawals, and letting SIPs run at least a year to maximize compounding and minimize risk.

items.title: What could Elon Musk buy with $1 trillion? Endless possibilities as Tesla CEO secures historic pay package
items.summary: Historic though it might be, Elon Musk's pay package of $1 trillion, with 12 zeros in it, is hard for the human mind to comprehend. To highlight what kind of enormous wealth we're talking about here, we'll take you through some of the things that Musk could purchase with his new pay package.

items.title: Building the future, one digital square foot at a time
items.summary: At the Global Fintech Festival 2025 in Mumbai, Alt DRX’s leadership unpacked how tokenisation is transforming India’s most coveted asset class—real estate—into something accessible and liquid. The conversation with co-founders Anand Narayanan, Avinash Rao, and Sachin Joshi followed a glowing reference by Nandan Nilekani, linking their innovation to India’s digital public infrastructure and the country’s growing “financial internet.”

items.title: SEBI to review short selling, SLB frameworks: Pandey

items.title: Vodafone Idea share price jumps over 4% ahead of Q2 results 2025. Do you own?
items.summary: Vodafone Idea share price has gained 4% in one month and has rallied over 42% in three months. The telecom stock has risen 38% in six months, while it has advanced 20% on a year-to-date (YTD) basis.

items.title: Sebi to form working group to revamp short-selling, securities-lending framework
items.summary: Sebi aims to better interlink the cash equities and derivatives markets, an objective that regulators worldwide have pursued to ensure efficient price discovery and reduce settlement stress.

items.title: This multibagger jewellery stock defies market weakness, jumps 70% in just 10 sessions. Is it in your portfolio?
items.summary: Thangamayil Jewellery share price has surged 8% to a record high of  ₹3,319.80 on November 7, extending its winning streak to six sessions. The company reported strong Q2 results, with a net profit of  ₹58.15 crore, and opened seven new stores, boosting retail presence.

items.title: LSC announces launch of the World Squash League
items.summary: World Premier Squash will introduce a team-first format centred on athletic excellence, gender balance and new scoring formats designed to enhance fan experience, says LSC

items.title: KP Energy net profit up 44% to ₹36 crore in Q2
items.summary: "The company has recorded its highest-ever Q2 PAT on a consolidated basis for Q2FY26 at ₹35.94 crore in comparison to that for Q2FY25 at ₹24.94 crore representing a growth of  44%," said a regulatory filing

items.title: Japan's Nikkei suffers worst week since April as AI shares sell off
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei index experienced its largest weekly fall since April. This decline was driven by tech stocks mirroring a drop in US markets. Investors are concerned about high valuations. Corporate results also played a role, with some companies reporting disappointing figures. However, Recruit Holdings and Nissan Motor saw gains following their financial updates.

items.title: Pine Labs IPO subscribed 13% on Day 1. GMP positive; should you consider applying?
items.summary: Pine Labs' Rs 3,900 crore IPO opened with a 13% subscription on its first day, indicating a slow start. The company, a leading merchant commerce platform, aims to use IPO proceeds for debt repayment and growth initiatives. Analysts recommend subscribing for long-term investment, citing strong growth and a robust addressable market.

items.title: Lifting of curbs on bank acquisition financing to aid economy, says RBI chief
items.summary: Sanjay Malhotra also said supervisory actions have enabled an effective backstop to moderate or prune unsustainable growth

items.title: Smartworks Q2 loss narrows to ₹3crore, revenue rises 22% to ₹441 crore
items.summary: Total income grew 22% to ₹441.06 crore in July-September quarter of this fiscal from ₹360.84 crore in the corresponding period of the preceding year, according to a regulatory filing on Thursday

items.title: Bitcoin holds steady between $101K–$102K driven by hawkish Fed stance and weak macro cues
items.summary: Bitcoin traded steady between $101,000 and $102,000 on Friday amid a hawkish U.S. Fed stance and weak global cues. Ethereum slipped below $3,400, while altcoins saw mixed movement. Analysts said whale accumulation and ETF inflows could trigger a rebound if Bitcoin breaks above $102,500.

items.title: Regulations have to evolve keeping in mind the realities of time: RBI Guv Malhotra
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra says capital buffers, profitability and asset quality have improved sharply over the decade, calling for calibrated regulatory evolution

items.title: India, Angola to deepen defence, energy ties; $200 million Line of Credit to be finalised: MEA
items.summary: MEA Secretary of Economic Relations Sudhakar Dalela says India is engaging with its African partners in critical minerals exploration

items.title: Divi’s Laboratories Q2 Results: Cons profit jumps 35% YoY to Rs 689 crore, revenue up 16%
items.summary: Divi's Laboratories reported a robust financial performance for the second quarter of FY26, with consolidated net profit soaring by 35% year-on-year to Rs 689 crore. The pharmaceutical major also witnessed a significant 16% increase in consolidated revenue from operations, reaching Rs 2,715 crore for the period.

items.title: SpaceX to be listed on stock exchange? Elon Musk says 'at some point’
items.summary: Elon Musk expressed interest in allowing supporters to invest in SpaceX, hinting that the company could go public at some point.&nbsp;

items.title: Smartworks Q2 loss narrows to Rs 3cr, revenue rises 22pc to Rs 441cr
items.summary: Smartworks Coworking Spaces Ltd has significantly reduced its net loss to Rs 3.13 crore in the second quarter. This improvement comes despite increased expenses. The company's total income saw a healthy rise of 22 percent compared to the same period last year. Smartworks manages large office campuses across India and Singapore, sub-leasing them to various companies.

items.title: Citi sees 51% growth potential in Vodafone Idea shares, drives stock 5% high. Here’s why
items.summary: Citi reiterates “BUY” rating on Vodafone Idea with a target price of Rs 14, suggesting a 51% upside. The Supreme Court's order enables reassessment of Vodafone Idea’s AGR dues, providing potential government relief.

items.title: India stands at pivotal juncture as policy choices to shape next two decades: DBS report
items.summary: DBS Group Research’s report “India 2025-40 Outlook: Pivotal Juncture” says India’s growth path will depend on policy reforms, human capital, and investments. It projects 6.7% annual growth till 2040, with GDP crossing USD 11 trillion and rising service exports.

items.title: Vietnam's real estate developer Vingroup ventures into aviation, space
items.summary: Vietnam's richest man, Pham Nhat Vuong, has launched VinSpace Joint Stock Company to produce planes and spacecraft, expanding Vingroup's diverse portfolio. This new venture, with initial capital of $11.4 million, aims to complement existing Vingroup businesses and explore future growth in aerospace and related fields.

items.title: Artha Venture Fund I makes partial exit in Lemnisk at 17 times return
items.summary: The fund first backed Lemnisk in FY21 with a ₹1.1 crore seed funding at a valuation of about ₹7 crore, later adding another ₹9 crore across multiple rounds

items.title: Singtel sells about $1.2 billion stake in Bharti Airtel
items.summary: More than 55 million shares of Bharti Airtel were traded through block deals, according to data from LSEG

items.title: BHEL bags ₹6,650 crore NTPC contract to build 800-MW thermal unit in Odisha
items.summary: State-run Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd (BHEL) has secured a significant ₹6,650 crore order from NTPC Ltd to construct an 800-MW power unit at the Darlipali Supercritical Thermal Power Project in Odisha. The EPC contract includes design, supply, erection, and commissioning, with completion expected within 48 months.

items.title: Japan's long-dated bond yields rise as PM picks reflationists for key posts
items.summary: Japanese government bond yields saw an uptick, particularly for longer-term debt, following Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's appointments of fiscal stimulus advocates to key economic roles. This shift has reignited concerns about government spending, impacting yields across various maturities. Market sentiment remains cautious, with fiscal developments and overseas interest rates now the primary drivers for JGBs.

items.title: Air India pilot not to be blamed, don't carry burden on yourself: SC to father of pilot killed in plane crash
items.summary: Air India Crash: Supreme Court on Friday said the preliminary report on Air India fatal crash that killed hundreds does not blame the pilot. The top court said it will hear the plea by pilot's father, who is asking for an independent probe, on November 10.

items.title: Japan eyes mid-year reviews of bond issuance plans to boost market stability, sources say
items.summary: Japan's Ministry of Finance is exploring mid-year reviews for government bond issuance. This move aims to boost market stability. Currently, plans are set annually. A recent cut in super-long bond sales eased market oversupply concerns. The proposed change would allow adjustments based on market conditions. This marks a significant shift in Japan's bond issuance framework.

items.title: Lupin shares jump 2% as Q2 PAT soars 73% YoY to Rs 1,485 crore
items.summary: Lupin shares rose on Friday after the pharma major reported a robust 73% YoY surge in Q2 FY26 PAT to Rs 1,485 crore, driven by strong sales growth, margin expansion, and operational efficiency. Revenue jumped 24% YoY to Rs 6,831 crore, while EBITDA soared 76%.

items.title: Dutch initiative to drive high-value horticulture in India’s peri-urban regions
items.summary: Pilots being set up near Chennai, Bengaluru and Chandigarh to grow strawberries round the year

items.title: Ambit initiates coverage on Lenskart with sell rating, cites valuation concerns
items.summary: Ambit flags sharp disconnect between Lenskart’s growth prospects and its return ratios

items.title: Samara Capital preps full exit from ESME Consumer, appoints banker

A public listing may be considered if the sale plans fail. ESME reported an Ebitda loss as revenues declined in FY24.

items.title: Sebi flags 1 lakh social media posts for misleading content, says unregulated influencers pose direct risk
items.summary: SEBI Chairperson Tuhin Kanta Pandey said the regulator has flagged over 1 lakh misleading social media posts, warning that unregulated influencers pose a direct threat to investors. Speaking at the CNBC-TV18 Summit, he outlined reforms to enhance transparency, governance, and capital market inclusivity.

items.title: Obesity drug Mounjaro becomes India's top-selling drug by value in October

Sensex, Nifty, Share Price Highlights: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty closed lower in a highly volatile trade on Thursday amid relentless foreign fund outflows and selling in blue-chip ICICI Bank.

Falling for the second day in a row, the 30-share BSE Sensex declined 148.14 points or 0.18 per cent to settle at 83,311.01. During the day, it hit a high of 83,846.35 and a low of 83,237.65.

The 50-share NSE Nifty dipped by 87.95 points or 0.34 per cent to 25,509.70.

Among Sensex firms, Power Grid, Eternal, Bharat Electronics, Bajaj Finance, ICICI Bank and NTPC were the major laggards.

Howev

items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
